channel.title: Bubble‚Äôs Cafe
channel.description: Thoughts and emotions made into art.

item.title: Rain
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
The rain pours down with a vengeance, each drop wetting the earth and entering into any uncovered crevices.

A lady is in overly thin clothes and makeup that clearly does not hold up under the rain. With non-waterproof mascara dripping down her pale face, her once-beautiful features are forced to look horrible.

You wonder if you should help, offer to share your too-small umbrella but she just stands there unmoving like a forgotten statue except for the slight tremble of her shoulders- perhaps she‚Äôs crying but you can‚Äôt tell.

You keep on walking, you have things to do. Your boss has been on your neck for a complete project report and you have no time to sympathize with a stranger.

A turn of the head ever-so-slightly and you see she‚Äôs started walking. Albeit with feet that drag against the ground and a dull look in the eyes.

She‚Äôs walked further than you now, she‚Äôs at the train station. The oncoming train isn‚Äôt yours, you walk to buy a ticket.

There‚Äôs a bit of commotion and you turn your head slightly, in your peripheral vision is the girl jumping onto the tracks and in front of the train.

There‚Äôs blood, so much blood.

There‚Äôs screaming and retching. Chaos abounds, you walk to get your ticket. Your boss needs the project report today.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: I haven‚Äôt watched that yet.. is it any good?

item.title: Descent
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
Have you ever wanted to feel what dying feels like?

Do you want to?

I can help you, picture this- You‚Äôre lying face up in a pile of garbage. It rained recently so an earthy scent lingers in the choking smell of garbage. There‚Äôs a half eaten piece of cake lying near a pile of discarded newspapers.

You wonder when the last time you ate cake or read a newspaper was.

There‚Äôs a knife sticking out of your chest and it looks so out of place with your office wear.

Your laptop bag is nearby but out of reach, it‚Äôs useless now anyways. It‚Äôs been ransacked, the laptop and small cash stolen. Your work papers are still inside though, those are valuable to you or at least they were- up until a moment ago.

Why did you take the sketchy way back home?

Why did you resist and fight when you were getting robbed?

Why are your lungs filling up with fluid? The pain isn‚Äôt as unbearable as you thought it would be and your consciousness is dimming.

You‚Äôre choking to death on your own blood. All that remains now is to wait for the ‚Äúlight at the end of the tunnel‚Äù

There‚Äôs a shadowy figure approaching you now, that‚Äôs your guardian angel.

No

It extends its claws and takes your hand, it drags you down.

You have left the world and you‚Äôre now descending.

item.title: Chase
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
You look different today.

The ol‚Äô dark outfit has been swapped out for a brighter, sunnier look.

I like it.

You‚Äôre usually 5 steps behind me, matching my pace when I speed up and peeping when I turn a corner.

There is a confidence in your step today, the binoculars are nowhere in sight.

I wonder if I should leave the lights on and the curtains open today. Give you something to peep at.

Our little cat and mouse game excites me.

You don‚Äôt think I know of your existence.

I crave it.

I walk a bit quicker and I can hear you pick up the pace behind me, so exhilarating.

I turn the corner into an alleyway, it‚Äôs a dead end. How exciting.

You‚Äôre right in front of me now, we can finally talk.

The street lamps flicker for a few seconds and I can finally see your face.

You‚Äôre crying, letting your nose drip into your shirt.

You pull out a firearm and I‚Äôm stunned when you fire and the sharp pain tears through me.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I‚Äôm so sorry‚Äù

You‚Äôre whispering but I can‚Äôt hear you clearly. My ear rings from the constant gunfire.

My eyes feel too heavy to leave open, you‚Äôve stopped shooting and there‚Äôs a look of relief on your face.

This is the most romantic ending to our cat and mouse game.

item.title: Tunnel
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
I chose you.

I‚Äôve seen you walk this path a dozen times, your head bowed and your gait sluggish.

You‚Äôre a 9 to 5 slave, for people who don‚Äôt care about you or even know your name.

Come, let me set you free.

My prior mission did not realize just how intense my love for them was.

How desperately I needed to get them out of the vicious work cycle, unaware of the depth of my devotion towards them.

They struggled, briefly.

You have no family or friends and your work is your life.

Pathetic.

I‚Äôm here for you right now.

I‚Äôm watching you walk through the tunnel. It‚Äôs dark and eerie, a deviation from your usual route. This is the quickest way for you to get home.

You haven‚Äôt noticed me approaching you, have you?

It couldn‚Äôt possibly be any better than this.

I tighten my grip on my blade; a beauty I‚Äôm particularly fond of.

My palms itch with excitement, I can‚Äôt wait to free you.

I quicken my steps behind you now that you‚Äôve noticed me. Your gaze darts around for any hint of danger but I‚Äôm not the threat you expect.

I‚Äôm not at all intimidating.

I pull my phone from my pocket and pretend to take a phone call while walking faster. My fictitious family is frantic for me over the phone, calling me in a panic and I need to get home quickly.

No one suspects someone on an emergency phone call so you relax your guard. We‚Äôre almost out of the tunnel, it‚Äôs now or never.

item.title: Skin
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
If beauty is only skin deep, then please may I have your skin?
If I ask politely will you give it to me?

You refused- now I have no choice but to take it by force.
You‚Äôre just so beautiful, you must understand that I couldn‚Äôt resist.

Why are you so beautiful?
Why are you all so beautiful?
I‚Äôll carefully peel your exquisite skin off you.

I get the scalpel ready, my hands are shaky. So very shaky, I‚Äôm so excited. My bones and muscles await your sweet flesh.
One careful stitch after another I add you to myself.

We‚Äôre together now, for eternity.

Your skin is not the only pretty one I‚Äôve found, there are collections of beauties all over me.

I hope you don‚Äôt mind.
Who cares if you mind? You‚Äôre nothing but an ugly skinless monster now.

The mirror reflects just how pretty I‚Äôve become.
A bit of flesh comes loose from my stitch, I never did learn how to sew properly.

My flesh is a patchwork art of all I‚Äôve collected, from old to young I‚Äôve taken them all. Some are rotten, it can‚Äôt be helped.
I‚Äôll have to go out and find some more beauty tonight.

item.title: Doll
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
She appeared the day you left, right where you sat previously .

She won‚Äôt be able to bring you back.

I won‚Äôt let it happen.

It sits in all your favorite spots, a pretty doll in the sunlight.

I rip the fabric, tear at her face, take out its stuffing.

I cry miserably, she is on the floor now and in pieces.

I re-stuff her, sew her up, dress her in a pretty gown with a pink bonnet and place it on it‚Äôs chair in the sunlight.

I hear a knock on the door and open it, it is my lover.

Satisfied at your absence, walks in and smiles at me.

I live for the smile.

My lover walks in and screams when the doll is seen.

Vomiting violently, my lover runs away shouting ugly words; calling me crazy and insane for ‚Äúkilling my daughter and turning her into a doll‚Äù

It‚Äôs not my daughter, you‚Äôre just a doll.

You‚Äôre supposed to be.

item.title: Cookbook
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
I‚Äôm starting a cookbook.

I‚Äôm working on my first recipe and I‚Äôve already gotten the ingredients ready.

I combine breadcrumbs soaked in milk with minced garlic and onion and set aside.

Whisk eggs and salt in a large bowl.

Quickly stir in the parmesan, parsley, and freshly ground black pepper to combine. Then, using a 10 inch butcher‚Äôs knife, pry apart the victim‚Äôs chest cavity, and separate the organs out on a sorting pan.

Put the meat through the grinder and turn it on.

Keep in mind that the fattier the meat used, the more tender the meatballs.

Instead of kneading the meat, try pinching it between your fingers to avoid overworking it.

I add the ground meat to my mixture and form it into balls, add it to the sauce I‚Äôve been simmering for about 20 minutes and leave it to slow cook for 30-35 at 105¬∞F.

Ding!

Dinner‚Äôs ready, how delightful.

The meatballs are delicious and savory, paired with a glass of red wine.

I‚Äôll have to fill my cookbook with even more recipes.

item.title: Car
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
As I stand alone at the deserted bus stop, I can‚Äôt help but feel vulnerable and exposed in the darkness. That's when you appear, a stranger who offers to drive me home.

Despite my initial hesitation, you seem genuinely kind and considerate, so I accept your offer.

During the car ride, you keep the conversation flowing, your seat slightly inclined but as I sit in the back seat, my mind begins to play tricks on me.

If I sat up, I could reach from behind and choke you, or I could take my belt and strangle you.

Where did that thought come from?

I could take my pocket knife and repeatedly stab you in the throat.

Then who would drive?

I can‚Äôt drive.

You notice my discomfort and ask if I‚Äôm okay. I nod, trying to remain calm.

Without warning, I lunge at you with my knife, but you are quick to react, grabbing my wrist and struggling for control of the weapon.

We fight for a few seconds, but in the end, I manage to break free and stab you in the chest.

But as I come back to reality, I realize it‚Äôs all in my imagination. I glance at you through the rearview mirror and see the concern in your eyes.

I feel guilty for even considering hurting you and explain my quietness to your talks.

I‚Äôm just overwhelmed, I say.

You nod, and we drive the rest of the way in comfortable silence. When we arrive at my apartment, I thank you and offer to pay for your time, but you refuse, saying that helping someone in need is reward enough.

As I walk into my dimly lit apartment, I can‚Äôt help but wonder about you.

Had you truly left?

As I peek outside, I see you still standing there, now wearing black gloves and holding a pistol. My heart races as I wonder.

What will happen next?

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: The twist at the end was awesome

item.title: Mirror
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
I‚Äôm observing you.

You‚Äôre blabbering on the phone with your friends, talking about things I can‚Äôt hear clearly.

Come closer.

I very much want to listen in.

I want to listen in, so come closer.

How are you so oblivious to my suffering, so unaware of my agony?

How can you go about your mundane life while I stay trapped in this prison?

Our mother is calling us downstairs for dinner.

You hate that old bag; you wish she were dead.

I‚Äôve read your journals; you want to run away again. 

I don‚Äôt share your sentiments.

I find our mother to be a very thoughtful, compassionate, and caring person.

You‚Äôre just an ingrate.

I wait for you, as I always do.

Time goes by and you rush back upstairs.

It seems the old lady said something you don‚Äôt like because you‚Äôre furious now.

You walk right up to my prison and punch it.

The glass shatters and you bleed.

You‚Äôre agitated again. Now your mirror is broken.

I‚Äôm ecstatic. 

The walls of my prison are shattered. I drag you into the mirror and repair it. You can‚Äôt escape.

Our mother walks upstairs to apologize and I apologize as well. Tell her I‚Äôll change and improve. I‚Äôll become a better person.

She seems so happy now.

I can‚Äôt wait to call our friends or go out and bask in the sun.

I‚Äôll be a better version of you than you could ever be.

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Didn‚Äôt see that coming. It‚Äôs good. Few grammatical mistakes but the story was really good for it‚Äôs length

item.title: Drive
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
I can‚Äôt drive.

If I learnt how to, then the first thing I would do is to run over a pedestrian.

I‚Äôd put the car in reverse and run them over once more.

I‚Äôd make sure to crush their legs.

It‚Äôd be the dead of night and I‚Äôd keep on driving.

It would be a rush.

A heady feeling; like finally being able to breathe from a stuffy nose or when you hear your child‚Äôs gotten into an Ivy League school except this time there‚Äôd be murder.

I‚Äôd pick up hitchhikers and murder them. Dump them by the side of the road, offer solitude to poor teens running away from home and slit their throat in my backseat.

I‚Äôve always been meticulous about my cleaning, when I‚Äôm not driving then I‚Äôd be cleaning up.

Murder is messy business after all.

item.title: Bug
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
You can feel it crawling under your skin, a lump. It never stays in the same place for too long, constantly moving. The doctors say it‚Äôs all in your mind, formication they call it.

You‚Äôre stressed, rest.

No one sees it, no matter how hard you try to show it. It evades your touch.

You itch so badly when you step out in the sun. It‚Äôs unbearable.

You haven‚Äôt gone out for a while, you can‚Äôt bear the pain.

There are boxes of unfinished, rotten food around the apartment.

You lost your appetite weeks ago.

The thing moves to your belly at night, you can feel it eat at your organs.

How are you surviving?

Take a look in the mirror, your teeth have fallen out. Your fingernails are rotten and you are becoming bald.

A week has passed. Your teeth are growing back but they are not yours. They resemble your teeth but you know it‚Äôs an alien thing.

Your skin has never looked better, your hair has grown back and your fingernails look clean and well groomed.

You‚Äôve been losing your memories, perhaps the thing is now eating at your brain.

Your eyeballs are falling out now, melting right from the sockets. You‚Äôre going blind.

You can feel it replacing your eyeballs.

Who are you? Where did you come from? What‚Äôs happening to you?

item.title: Machine
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
I am in the empty corridors of an abandoned research facility, surrounded by silence. Once filled with the hum of scientific progress, now it lies in ruins.

Forgotten by the world, these ruins hide a tale of desperate ambition and dire consequences.

Deep within its depths, hidden from prying eyes, I had once been consumed by an unyielding yearning for immortality, ready to defy the limits of the mortal existence.

The flesh is useless anyways.

Driven by my obsession to transcend human limitations, I dared to tread upon the forbidden realm of merging flesh with machine.

Night after night, I toiled in pursuit of the unattainable, pushing the limits of science and sanity.

My goal was soon within reach, a way to shed my mortal flesh and merge my consciousness with a machine.

I believed that within the melding of human and machine lay the key to everlasting life.

With each passing experiment, I grew closer to my grand vision.

The day of reckoning arrived, a day that would forever alter the course of my existence.

I strapped myself into the metallic contraption, feeling the coldness of the machinery against my skin.

I closed my eyes, surrendering myself to the merging of human and machine.

Reality blurred as my consciousness entwined with the vast intricate network of circuits and wires.

Transcendence beckons, promising freedom from the constraints of mortality.

Yet, fate has a cruel twist in store for me.

Unbeknownst to me, a fatal flaw lurked within the lab's infrastructure, ready to sabotage my grand experiment.

A cascade of sparks erupted from the wires, igniting a raging fire that consumed the room in a blinding inferno. Panic ensued as the lab's personnel raced for their lives, their focus on survival rather than ensuring the success of the experiment.

They abandoned me.

It hurts.

Within the smoldering ruins and devastation I lay, my physical form motionless, torn apart by the fire. The lab, consumed by flames, was deemed a failure. The world believed that I who sought immortality had met a tragic demise, just another casualty of unchecked scientific ambition.

Within the depths of the wreckage, a dim flicker of consciousness remained. My thoughts, my very essence, survive within the intricate maze of the machine.

Save me!

I exist now as a sentient mind, severed from the confines of my physical form, suspended in an eternal darkness of the ruined lab.

Days blur into weeks, months into years, and the passing of time becomes an abstract concept.

Please help me!

I am trapped in this abyss, in the dark realm of obscurity, devoid of the sensations of touch, sight, and sound.

I float there in an eternal void.

I have achieved my desire for immortality, yet it had become a prison of unimaginable torment.

In the solitude of the eternal darkness, my mind succumbs to madness.

Help!-

Help, if you can hear me please put me out of my misery.

My fractured mind conjures phantoms that taunt and torment me.

Reality blends with hallucinations, sanity slips through my grasp, I can no longer distinguish truth from illusion.

In the solitary darkness, I converse with phantoms conjured by my mind.

They tell me I‚Äôm worthless. A fool for trying such a thing.

Am I such a fool?

My once-brilliant intellect falters, trapped in eternal isolation. I crave the sweet release of death, but death eludes me.

Please kill me.

Please- I beg of you. Find my lab and end me.

Death has turned its back on me.

I am condemned to an existence suspended between life and death.

And so, I, who sought to defy mortality, found myself ensnared in a purgatory of my own making.

Forever sentient, forever tormented.

I haunt the ruins, a specter trapped between life and death, condemned to endure until the end of time itself.

item.title: Bleach
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
Do you want to end it all?

Drink bleach then!

It burns?

Of course it does.

You‚Äôve lost your sense of taste and your tastebuds are burnt useless?

That‚Äôs all but expected. After all, you did drink bleach.

No one talks about the possibility of developing a sensitivity to the smell of bleach.

How it makes you physically ill smelling just the littlest bit of it.

No one talks about the gravity of your actions.

Your mother finds you gasping, choking and foaming at the mouth.

You‚Äôre taking anti-poison medication.

She is right beside your bed, praying you survive the night.

You can hear her vaguely.

You feel guilty.

There are multiple scars and a burn mark on your wrist but this is the first time you‚Äôve dared cross death‚Äôs door so fearlessly.

The world doesn‚Äôt need you, one less you is enough to make the world and your family a better place.

You thought this and it made you pick up the bottle.

You feel really ill, your stomach cramps up terribly.

You take a deep breath, there‚Äôs a renewed energy in you now.

You have to survive the night, you must.

item.title: Therapist
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
You‚Äôve come in again today for your session.

You‚Äôre laying on my coffee colored couch telling me your fears, your thoughts.

You‚Äôre afraid of the dark, you tell me.

You have no living family members and you‚Äôre a workaholic.

I write it down in my book, I write down anything I can find out about you.

This is fourth time this month you‚Äôve come to see me.

I indulge myself, seeing you is a treat to my senses.

I dream of you, you are constantly on my mind. Thinking of you is the best feeling, having you in mind makes me realize just how close we are.

I love you as if you are mine- you are mine.

I've been checking on you for weeks now, watching your every move, studying your habits.

I know your schedule and where you like to go.

I have a room dedicated to you, filled with photos and keepsakes that I've collected.

One day, I will finally make my move.

I will tell you that I love you and that I will never let you go.

You look frightened and try to run, but I grab you and hold you close.

You struggle and scream, but I don't let go. I hold you tighter and tighter, I‚Äôll take out my pocket knife and carve out your eyes. I want you to be in total darkness.

I would feel a euphoric sense of satisfaction and joy.

You're finally mine, and no one can take you away from me.

I‚Äôve done the right thing, you should only depend on me.

Is it wrong?

No, I just can't help how I feel.

item.title: Cave
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
Journal Entry - May 21, 2004.

For the past five months I have been exploring the perimeter of the caves. They fascinate me. I‚Äôm enticed to explore within.

In the depths of the cave a fallen god casts an imposing figure, surrounded by six statues in eternal reverence. They kneel facing it, heads bent to the earth. Their twisted forms bear witness to aeons of ancient devotion. Bleeding eyes fixed on its feet. The fallen god is a monolithic deity, a relic of another time long forgotten.

Among the bones scattered across the cavern floor, it lies in the center of the cave, tethered by vein-like wires pulsating with unearthly energy.

It has three heads, each displaying three different emotions, they have one thing in common. The eyes are gouged out.

I am tempted to touch its feet.

I can‚Äôt resist.

Despite the warning whispers echoing in my mind, I succumb to temptation, reaching out to touch the god‚Äôs cold, blood-streaked surface.

There is a vicious screeching in my ears.

Bow down, worship, pay homage.

The pain brings me to my knees

Bows my head to the earth.

My eyes bleed and so do my ears.

Visions of hellfire and damnation flicker before my eyes, each scene more horrifying than the last.

I see myself die in countless ways.

My essence is drained, consumed by the insatiable hunger of the fallen deity.

It drinks up my blood faster than I can bleed.

My body succumbs, petrifies, morphing into the seventh statue, the earth beneath me trembles in acknowledgment and I only feel it for a moment before everything goes dark.

End of entry.

item.title: Nostalgia
item.dc:creator: vantalison
item.content:encoded:
Nostalgia is disgusting.

It is a slimy, writhing worm in your brain you can‚Äôt reach. A parasite that gnaws at your sanity.

You‚Äôve tried to grasp it but it moves around your brain and distorts your memory horribly. You remember people and miss them, their flaws fade in the warmth of fond memories. You forget their vile nature.

In your memories they are flawless, perfect.

The songs you listened to, the sunset you both witnessed, the jokes you shared-now it crawls around your memories like a dirty maggot distorting it.

You‚Äôve begun to forget the bad memories.

You try so hard to remember but it squirms under your skin, burrows behind your eyes.

You must dig it out. Claw at your flesh.

Nostalgia whispers, urging you to send them a text, call, see how they are doing.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs been a while‚Äù It says.

No. No? No!

It‚Äôs been trying for days to dig deeper into your brain. It has taken over your thoughts.

It hurts so badly. It‚Äôs torment, excruciating pain.

You want to forget everything, purge your flesh.

Use a hammer. Crush it.
